weather_report:
As the sun paints the sky with clarity this afternoon, Downtown San Francisco basks under a slightly hesitant sun, with temperatures drifting downwards from a mild high. The forecast hints at a mere whisper of rain, a 20% chance that may stir nostalgic thoughts of more tempestuous winters. The clouds float lazily, reluctant to obscure the striking views of the city and its famed landmarks. While the air holds a brisk edge, the wind dances gently from the northwest, carrying the salty tang of the bay and the promise of a comforting evening.

Tonight, the clarity will remain intimate, revealing a serene embrace of stars overhead as temperatures settle around a cool 46 degrees. The moderate winds will continue, nudging along anyone who might roam the streets after dark. A cozy sweater or light jacket would serve as reassuring companions for those wandering into the charming haunts of the city. With the absence of fog and the serenity of the skies, one might find delight in a leisurely stroll, perhaps savoring a warm drink while peering at the iconic silhouettes against the fading light, breathing in the unique energy San Francisco effortlessly offers as dusk approaches.
